chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall (n : nat) (E : env ty) (t : term) (T : ty), j n E t T -> forall (x : nat) (E' : list (option ty)) (T' : ty), map (shift x) E = E' -> shift x T = T' -> j n E' t T'

Premises:
map : forall A B : Type, (A -> B) -> env A -> list (option B)
Inductive ty : Set := TyVar : nat -> ty | TyArrow : ty -> ty -> ty | TyForall : ty -> ty Arguments TyVar _%nat_scope
Inductive t : nat -> Set := F1 : forall n : nat, Fin.t (S n) | FS : forall n : nat, Fin.t n -> Fin.t (S n) Arguments Fin.t _%nat_scope Arguments Fin.F1 {n}%nat_scope Arguments Fin.FS {n}%nat_scope
Inductive term : Set := TVar : nat -> term | TAbs : term -> term | TApp : term -> term -> term Arguments TVar _%nat_scope
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
env = fun A : Type => list (option A) : Type -> Type Arguments env _%type_scope
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Notation shift := (lift 1)
Inductive option (A : Type) : Type := Some : A -> option A | None : option A Arguments option _%type_scope Arguments Some {A}%type_scope a : rename Arguments None {A}%type_scope
Inductive j : nat -> env ty -> term -> ty -> Prop := JVar : forall (n : nat) (E : env ty) (x : nat) (T : ty), lookup x E = Some T -> j n E (TVar x) T | JAbs : forall (m n : nat) (E : env ty) (t : term) (T1 T2 : ty), j m (insert 0 T1 E) t T2 -> j n E (TAbs t) (TyArrow T1 T2) | JApp : forall (n m1 m2 : nat) (E : env ty) (t1 t2 : term) (T1 T2 : ty), j m1 E t1 (TyArrow T1 T2
term_weakening : forall (n : nat) (E : env ty) (t : term) (T : ty), j n E t T -> forall (x : nat) (U : ty) (E' : env ty), insert x U E = E' -> j n E' (shift x t) T
j_sind : forall P : nat -> env ty -> term -> ty -> SProp, (forall (n : nat) (E : env ty) (x : nat) (T : ty), lookup x E = Some T -> P n E (TVar x) T) -> (forall (m n : nat) (E : env ty) (t : term) (T1 T2 : ty), j m (insert 0 T1 E) t T2 -> P m (insert 0 T1 E) t T2 -> P n E (TAbs t) (TyArrow T1 T2)) ->...-> P n e t t0
j_ind : forall P : nat -> env ty -> term -> ty -> Prop, (forall (n : nat) (E : env ty) (x : nat) (T : ty), lookup x E = Some T -> P n E (TVar x) T) -> (forall (m n : nat) (E : env ty) (t : term) (T1 T2 : ty), j m (insert 0 T1 E) t T2 -> P m (insert 0 T1 E) t T2 -> P n E (TAbs t) (TyArrow T1 T2)) ->...-> P n e t t0
j_index_monotonic : forall (n : nat) (E : env ty) (t : term) (T : ty), j n E t T -> forall m : nat, m >= n -> j m E t T
JTyAbs : forall (n : nat) (E : env ty) (t : term) (T : ty), j n (map (shift 0) E) t T -> j n E t (TyForall T)
JVar : forall (n : nat) (E : env ty) (x : nat) (T : ty), lookup x E = Some T -> j n E (TVar x) T
JTyApp : forall (n m : nat) (E : env ty) (t : term) (T U U' : ty), j m E t (TyForall T) -> m < n -> subst U 0 T = U' -> j n E t U'
JApp : forall (n m1 m2 : nat) (E : env ty) (t1 t2 : term) (T1 T2 : ty), j m1 E t1 (TyArrow T1 T2) -> j m2 E t2 T1 -> j n E (TApp t1 t2) T2
JAbs : forall (m n : nat) (E : env ty) (t : term) (T1 T2 : ty), j m (insert 0 T1 E) t T2 -> j n E (TAbs t) (TyArrow T1 T2)
closed = fun (T : Type) (H : Lift T) (k : nat) (t : T) => shift k t = t : forall T : Type, Lift T -> nat -> T -> Prop Arguments closed {T}%type_scope {H} _%nat_scope
recognize_subst : TraverseFunctorial -> TraverseIdentifiesVar -> TraverseRelative -> TraverseRelative -> forall traverse_ : (nat -> nat -> ty) -> nat -> ty -> ty, traverse_ = traverse -> forall (v : ty) (k2 k1 : nat) (t : ty), traverse_ (fun l x : nat => subst_idx (lift l 0 v) (l + k2) x) k1 t = subst (lift k1 0 v) (k1 + k2) t
recognize_lift : TraverseRelative -> forall (w k1 k2 : nat) (t : ty) (traverse_ : (nat -> nat -> ty) -> nat -> ty -> ty), traverse_ = traverse -> traverse_ (fun l x : nat => var (lift w (l + k2) x)) k1 t = lift w (k1 + k2) t
closed_lift_invariant : forall k t : nat, closed k t -> forall j : nat, j >= k -> forall w : nat, lift w j t = t
rotate = fun (V : Type) (H : Var V) (T : Type) (H0 : Lift T) (H1 : Subst V T) (n : nat) (t : T) => subst (var n) 0 (shift (S n) t) : forall V : Type, Var V -> forall T : Type, Lift T -> Subst V T -> nat -> T -> T Arguments rotate {V}%type_scope {H} {T}%type_scope {H0 H1} _%nat_scope
subst_lift : forall (v : ty) (k : nat) (t : ty), subst v k (shift k t) = t
subst_lift_generalized : forall (n : nat) (v t : ty), subst v n (lift (S n) 0 t) = lift n 0 t
expand_subst : forall (v : ty) (k : nat) (t : ty), subst v k t = traverse (fun l x : nat => subst_idx (lift l 0 v) (l + k) x) 0 t
traverse_relative : forall (f g : nat -> nat -> ty) (p : nat) (t : ty) (m l : nat), (forall l0 x : nat, f (l0 + p) x = g l0 x) -> m = l + p -> traverse f m t = traverse g l t
subst_subst : forall (t : ty) (k : nat) (v : ty) (s : nat) (w : ty), k <= s -> subst v s (subst w k t) = subst (subst v s w) k (subst (shift k v) (1 + s) t)
closed_monotonic : LiftLift -> forall k t : nat, closed k t -> forall j : nat, j >= k -> closed j t
traverse_var_is_identity : forall f : nat -> nat -> ty, (forall l x : nat, f l x = var x) -> forall (t : ty) (l : nat), traverse f l t = t
Build_TraverseRelative : forall (V T : Type) (H : Traverse V T), (forall (f g : nat -> nat -> V) (p : nat) (t : T) (m l : nat), (forall l0 x : nat, f (l0 + p) x = g l0 x) -> m = l + p -> traverse f m t = traverse g l t) -> TraverseRelative
Subst_Traverse = fun (V : Type) (H : Var V) (H0 : Traverse V V) (T : Type) (H1 : Traverse V T) => {| subst := fun (v : V) (k : nat) (t : T) => traverse (fun l x : nat => subst_idx (lift l 0 v) (l + k) x) 0 t |} : forall V : Type, Var V -> Traverse V V -> forall T : Type, Traverse V T -> Subst V T Arguments Subst_Traverse {V}%type_scope {H H0} {T}%type_scope {H1}
map_insert_eq : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (x : nat) (a : A) (b : B) (e : env A), f a = b -> map f (insert x a e) = insert x b (map f e)
Lift_Traverse = fun (V : Type) (H : Var V) (T : Type) (H0 : Traverse V T) => {| lift := fun (w k : nat) (t : T) => traverse (fun l x : nat => var (lift w (l + k) x)) 0 t |} : forall V : Type, Var V -> forall T : Type, Traverse V T -> Lift T Arguments Lift_Traverse {V}%type_scope {H} {T}%type_scope {H0}

```coq
intros n E t T.
induction n using j_ind.
- intros x E' T' H1 H2.
  inversion H1; subst.
  constructor; auto.
- intros m n E t T1 T2 H3 H4 IHn.
  intros x E' T' H1 H2.
  inversion H3; subst.
  constructor; auto.
  apply IHn; auto.
- intros n m1 m2 E t1 t2 T1 T2 H3 H4 H5 IHn1 IHn2.
  intros x E' T' H1 H2.
  inversion H3; subst.
  constructor; auto.
  apply IHn1; auto.
  apply IHn2; auto.
Qed.

original: intros n E t T. induction n using j_ind. - intros x E' T' H1 H2. inversion H1; subst. constructor; auto. - intros m n E t T1 T2 H3 H4 IHn. intros x E' T' H1 H2. inversion H3; subst. constructor; auto. apply IHn; auto. - intros n m1 m2 E t1 t2 T1 T2 H3 H4 H5 IHn1 IHn2. intros x E' T' H1 H2. inversion H3; subst. constructor; auto. apply IHn1; auto. apply IHn2; auto.
